revision.text: ==English== {{wikipedia}} ===Alternative forms=== * {{q|from [[Wade–Giles]]}} {{l|en|Hsiang-chou}} ===Etymology=== From the {{bor|en|cmn-pinyin|-}} romanization of the {{bor|en|cmn|-}} pronunciation for {{zh-l|襄州}}. ===Pronunciation=== {{rfp|en}} ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun}} # {{place|en|district|prefecture-level city/Xiangyang|p/Hubei|c/China}}. #* {{quote-web |en |date=01/29/2016 |author=Editorial Office |title=Chenghe Wickerwork |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20220730142212/https://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache%3Ahttp%3A%2F%2Fen.hubei.gov.cn%2Fculture%2Fintangible%2F201601%2Ft20160129_1412132.shtml |archivedate=30 July 2022 |work=Hubei Provincial People's Government Official Web Portal |url=http://en.hubei.gov.cn/culture/intangible/201601/t20160129_1412132.shtml |text=Chenghe wickerwork, also known as Xiangyang wickerwork, is a specialty of Chenghe town<!--程河镇-->, '''Xiangzhou''' district, Xiangyang city, and a product with protected geographical indication in China. Chenghe is one of the top three wickerwork export bases in China.}} #* {{quote-book |en |year=2021 |last=Ge |first=Jianxiong |last2=Hu |first2=Yunsheng |title=A Historical Survey of the Yellow River and the River Civilizations |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=iiASEAAAQBAJ |ISBN=978-981-33-4480-8 |ISSN=2196-3134 |OCLC=1201384776 |page=184 |text=Northern Hubei was centered around '''Xiangzhou''', Xiangyang (modern Xiangfan of Hubei), the seat of local government of '''Xiangzhou''', was a major gathering point for southward emigration out of the Central Plains due to its location at the intersection between the Han River and the trunk road from Nanyang to Jiangling.}} ====Translations==== {{trans-top|district in central China}} * Chinese: *: Mandarin: {{t+|cmn|襄州|tr=Xiāngzhōu|sc=Hani}} {{trans-mid}} * Japanese: {{t-needed|ja}} {{trans-bottom}}
